title: Good but not special
text: Average 3 story motel with no curb appeal. Tiny reception area. Courteous staff. Nice sized rooms with one or two beds with fridge and desk. Bathrooms nd rooms are dated, but comfortable. Breakfast to go was yogurt, muffin, hard boiled egg and coffee.

title: Clean and cheap
text: The Briarwood Inn is in a convenient location. The front desk person was very pleasant and helpful in checking in and finding us an excellent restaurant. Motel type with exterior doors. Rooms are clean. Beds are comfortable. New laminate floors. Very small, but adequate bathroom. Fridge and microwave. Breakfast consists of donuts and coffee. Very reasonably priced. Fine for the one night we stayed.

title: Great food
text: The Horsefly Brewing Company is a great place for their local brews. All great. The food is great too. An extensive menu. Appetizers, to salads, soups, sandwiches, and entrees. Great taco basket, good burger, green chili soup, and fish and chips. All done well. The Jazzy Razzy beer was tops. Plenty of inside and outside seating as well as evening entertainment. Glad we found this place.

title: Nice location
text: The Wyndham Inn on Long Wharf is a redecorated hotel. I stayed in a one bedroom unit with a nice bedroom, bathroom, and partial kitchen. Galley kitchen is nice and has everything other than an oven. Nice TV and living room with a 4 chair dining table. No balcony, but ceiling to floor windows overlooking the harbor. Great location to walk anywhere downtown. Dozens of restaurants and shops. Parking under building.
place: Club Wyndham Inn on Long Wharf

title: Excellent breakfast
text: Rocco's is known for their pizza, but breakfast there was great. Right on the broadwalk within view of the ocean, they have an excellent breakfast menu. From 3 egg omelettes to breakfast sandwiches and breakfast calzones. I had a huge veggie pesto egg calzone which was tasty and hot. A cup of coffee and I was ready for the day. You won't be disappointed. Waitress was pleasant and attentive.

title: Great Cuban Food
text: Havana 1957 is located on the first floor of the Breakwater Hotel on Ocean Drive sprawling out into the street into the pedestrian walkway. The location is perfect. Steps away from the beach, having great food and drinks while people watching. The food is excellent with all Cuban specialties. Foe lunch I had the Cuban sampler. Platter of Havana 1957 chicken Ropa Vieja, and Lechon.Nice portion of rice, black beans, salad, and sweet plantains. Ver tasty and a portion big enough for two. The Cuban sandwich looked great, and also huge, two can share. A great place to eat.

title: Good, not great today
text: While I've been here before, today was disappointing. Busy as they have a good reputation, I was seated inlet side watching the boats coming and going in the harbor. Martinis were good. Nice warm bread. Good service, but that's where it ended. The "angry shrimp" were under seasoned and the sauce was citrusy and bland. The scallops served over bone marrow were seasoned nicely, but the bone was an esthetic vehicle with an acidic chimichuri type sauce with out the umsciousness of bone marrow. The need to taste their new creations before putting them on the menu.

title: Hustle and bustle and people
text: Ocean Drive with all its shops, restaurants, and hotels is THE happening place in South Beach. Closed to traffic as a pedestrian walkway, it's bordered by the beautiful Atlantic Ocean ans the many restaurants and shops. And for people watching...it's incredible. Walk, eat, shop, relax at the park between the street and Ocean. You'll be happy.

title: One of the top beaches in the world
text: South Beach is beautiful. Deep soft sandy beach. Clear water. Beautiful sights. Many restaurants across the street. Relaxing, napping, daydreaming or people watching. A must destination.

title: Great for breakfast and lunch
text: On Ocean Drive, across the street from the beach, the Readhead Sandwich is a goog place. Not fancy. Go inside and order your food and they bring it out to your table. Breakfast at $7.99. Can't beat it. And the staff is extremely nice. Attentive and polite. Nice sandwiches and smoothies too. Will return.

title: Great breakfast
text: The Grateful Dedham Diner, other than the coffee mug, no relationship to the Dead, and not a Diner, but a restaurant, is a great place for breakfast. The servers are pleasant and responsive. Food, tops. The chocolate chip pancakes are light with tons of chocolate chips and the homemade corned beef hash is terrific. Great portions. Potatoes are crispy and flavorful. One of the best breakfasts ever. Going back tomorrow.

title: Great for breakfast
text: A nice sized setup restaurant with ample inside and outside dining. Very pleasant staff. Good menu. Had a wonderful Greek omelette with crispy potatoes. Good coffee. Proper sanitation and social distancing. Will dine again.

title: Great kosher supermarket/takeout
text: A small, but adequate kosher supermarket with most everything you might need. The best thing is the takeout! Great dairy selection of prepared dishes. Beautiful salmon filets and salmon cakes. Very tasty. Salads galore. Each one better than the next. Some baked goods and you're good to go.

title: Great frozen yogurt
text: A self service store with some inside and outside seating, Menchie's is a good place. About eight flavors of mix and match frozen yogurts, you can add toppings of your choice. Great flavor. You pay by weight, so don't go too crazy. All in all a top place.

title: Good kosher takeout
text: A small narrow store has almost anything you might want for a shabbos. From roasted chicken to soups, side dishes, salads. Tasty and nice service.

title: Good bagel store
text: Kupels has been around a long time and it's bagel selection and quality is excellent. From conventional bagels to whole wheat everything to cinnamon glaze. They're excellent. Also a nice selection of breads, challah, and pastries.

title: Good food. Great location
text: Giorgio's Bakery Cafe is a great place to eat in or take out. Was there for breakfast. Great venue. Sitting on the intracoastal with a view of docked boats and a few gliding past us. So relaxing. And of course, the food. Nice breakfast of Greek omelette with home fries and fresh baked rolls. Unlimited coffee. Great servers who are attentive. Have takeout of sandwiches, etc.. Will be back.

title: Great Peruvian Restaurant
text: El Tayta is an amazing Peruvian restaurant. Didn't even know that I liked Peruvian food. Extensive menu of appetizers and entrees with seafood, chicken, meat, rice and noodles. Something for everyone. Peruvian paella was excellent. Very tasty rice with plentiful fish/seafood with a smart complement of pickled red onions and tomatoes. A great dish.

title: Breakfast on the Broadwalk
text: Great location. Right on the beach with outdoor dining. A nice breakfast menu. Had a huge veggie omelette with toast and home fries. Good coffee. Other breakfast items looked good.

title: Average, but predictable
text: Friendly's is an older small chain with a large varied menu. While it's not gourmet, it's good food reasonably priced. From their Supermelt sandwiches, appetizers, double and triple burgers and tuna, chicken, and fish melts, there's something for everyone. And if you're a senior a special menu with senior deals. A good stop on a trip, or for a great ice cream sundae.

title: Beautiful deep sandy beach
text: Hollywood Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches on the east coast of Florida. Deep sandy beach. Groomed nicely daily. Lifeguards spaced adequately. A long stone walkway/bikeway that goes for miles. A great place to stay or visit. Many shops and a plethora of restaurants from burger joints and ice cream to fancy Italian, Cuba, and other ethnic restaurants. Large expansive beaches so not crowded. Can't go wrong.

title: Great Deli Sandwiches
text: A top notch Jewish deli with all the right foods. From turkey to corned beef, to roast beef and...wow, the pastrami is to die for. Great taste and an overfilled sandwich. The best ever! They have everything else from potato latkes to chicken soup and matzoh balls. Freshly baked bagels and lox. I'd go on, but I'm getting hungry. If you're driving by, stop in for a treat.

title: Great breakfast
text: Alvin's on the Beach is a great place for breakfast. Outdoor seating, steps away from the beach. A nice menu with good prices. Yvette was a great server, though busy she kept up with everything. Everything was made well. Beach breakfast was $5.99, coffee additional. Three Eggs, toast, meat, potatoes. Very good. Bagels and lox looked good, as did the smoked salmon hollandaise. Coffee was good too. Will be back tomorrow.

title: Great lunch
text: A busy Mexican and Cuban restaurant, and for a reason. Food is authentic. Very tasty. With dozens of choices. Beef, pork, chicken, and fish. Entrees, tacos, plates with fried plantains and different styles of rice and beans. Forget the fries. Get great food. Service was good, but a little slow as they were busy. But on a beautiful sunny day steps from the ocean, you can't go wrong.

title: Great for walking and biking
text: A long stone boardwalk that goes on and on. Walking side and bike and rollerblading side. Busy on weekends, but quieter on week days. Runs right along the beach with many restaurants and shops. Restrooms located periodically.

title: Great Market
text: Full service market with prepared foods, sandwiches, beer and wine. Breads and groceries. Cheeses and deli. Can buy almost anything you need or want.

title: Fair subs
text: A-1 Pizza serves average subs. Bread to filling ratio is poor. Not enough filling and under seasoned. Fries were good. Subway is more consistent and better. Disappointed.

title: Best ever!
text: The Brick Alley Pub on Thames Street is GREAT! An expansive restaurant on two floors with downstairs and upstairs bars and a number of uniquely decorated rooms. Booths and tables. Framed engaging pictures and news media on all the walls. The food and service is great. Great soups, sandwiches and entrees. Good Greek side salad. Crispy Calamari with banana peppers. A special Mike's Portuguese Clam Pasta, the bomb. Great flavorful sauce, with classic and sausage served over angel hair pasta. One of the best dishes I've ever had. And service...special. Will be back again and again.

title: Nice pizza
text: Sbarro at the rest area on the Connecticut Turnpike is a full service site. Pizzas, Stromboli, and more. Very attentive and pleasant staff. Good service.

title: Tiny Place, Big Food
text: Tiny's Diner is a small restaurant that is nostalgic of an old time Diner. A few bar stool and a number of booths with primary colored vinyl upholstery is fits the bill. Nice waitress and good service. Socially distanced and clean. Nicely priced lunchtime special with large portions and good prices. Stop in for a good breakfast or lunch.

title: Good food. Nice setting
text: The restaurant at Quechee Inn is a nice old time place. Not fancy, but classy. Tables Not too crowded near each other. Very respectful and helpful staff. Menu is excellent. Roasted half duck with crispy skin is tops. Ravioli excellent.. Nice drinks and wine. A spot not to miss.
place: The Quechee Inn at Marshland Farm Restaurant

title: Consistent and good
text: The Cheesecake Factory is a national chain that has consistent quality food. This one in Chestnut Hill is situated at a mall with a separate outside entrance. The menu is extensive. So much so that you need plenty of time to decide what to eat. Great salads with various styles and toppings. Meat, fish, and poultry entrees with combos. Of course great burgers. Have gone again and again. BTW, the Cheesecake and variations are outstanding.

title: Happy birthday to me
text: At I Hop for my annual birthday stack of...chocolate chip pancakes. Pleasant staff, not crowded, very socially distanced. Menu is excellent. From eggs, omelettes, great breakfast combos to lunch and dinner selections. Good, reasonably, and tasty fare.

title: Average lodging. Good location
text: The location was across the street from the beach, with other buildings across. Slight sea view. Adequate bedroom, very tight, but fully equipped gallery type kitchen. Living/dining room adequate with sofa, TV, and dining table. OK if you can't find an upgrade as location is good. Near restaurants and shopping.
